intro: Urostigma guatemalanum, commonly known as the Guatemalan false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and red. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Urostigma guatemalanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
